title: Licurse Score for Renal Ultrasound
description: Predicts likelihood of hydronephrosis on renal ultrasound (RUS) requiring urological intervention in adult patients with acute kidney injury

parameters.name: history_hydronephrosis
parameters.description: History of hydronephrosis (if yes, automatically assigns to high-risk group)

parameters.name: race
parameters.description: Patient race (non-black race is associated with higher risk)

parameters.name: recurrent_utis
parameters.description: History of recurrent urinary tract infections

parameters.name: obstruction_diagnosis
parameters.description: Diagnosis consistent with possible obstruction (BPH, abdominal/pelvic malignancy, neurogenic bladder, single functioning kidney, pelvic surgery)

parameters.name: prerenal_aki_sepsis
parameters.description: History of sepsis, prerenal AKI, pressors, or hypotension

result.name: licurse_score
result.description: Licurse Score for risk stratification of hydronephrosis on renal ultrasound

ranges.interpretation: Low risk group with 4.0% risk of hydronephrosis and 1.1% risk of intervention. Renal ultrasound may be deferred until other diagnostic studies prove unrevealing or inadequate response to conservative measures
Medium risk group with 6.8% risk of hydronephrosis and 0.5% risk of intervention. Consider clinical context and other factors when deciding on renal ultrasound
High risk group with 20.9% risk of hydronephrosis and 4.9% risk of urological intervention. Renal ultrasound is indicated for evaluation of possible obstruction

references: Licurse A, Dziura J, Spinella PC, et al. Renal ultrasonography in the evaluation of acute kidney injury: developing a risk stratification framework. Archives of Internal Medicine. 2010;170(21):1900-7. doi: 10.1001/archinternmed.2010.362.

Ip IK, Silveira PC, Alper EC, et al. External validation of risk stratification strategy in the use of renal ultrasonography in the evaluation of acute kidney injury. Journal of Hospital Medicine. 2016;11(5):316-21. doi: 10.1002/jhm.2598.
formula: Score = (Non-black race: 1 pt) + (Recurrent UTIs: 1 pt) + (Obstruction diagnosis: 1 pt) + (No CHF: 1 pt) + (No prerenal AKI/sepsis: 1 pt) + (No nephrotoxic exposure: 1 pt). History of hydronephrosis automatically assigns to high-risk group regardless of score.
notes: Developed from 223 patients at Yale-New Haven Hospital (2005-2009)
External validation showed 91.3% sensitivity for urologic intervention and 93.4% for hydronephrosis
Cost-effectiveness: NNS of 32 for hydronephrosis in low-risk group ($6,371 per positive study)
Should be used in conjunction with clinical judgment and patient presentation
Score helps reduce unnecessary ultrasounds while maintaining diagnostic accuracy
